title: COVID-19 Protocols Fall 2023
cleaned_text: COVID-19 Protocols Fall 2023 On This Page COVID-19 Testing [PCR Testing is available at a variety of locations in Santa Cruz County.](https://www.santacruzhealth.org/HSAHome/HSADivisions/PublicHealth/CommunicableDiseaseControl/CoronavirusHome/GetTested.aspx) COVID-19 Vaccination Policy [Visit this link for updates and communications on how to attest or decline](https://healthcenter.ucsc.edu/services/immunizations.html), when the process becomes available later this year. For staff and faculty COVID-19 information please visit the [Risk Services department website](https://risk.ucsc.edu/covid-19-support/index.html). Campus Masking While healthy individuals are no longer required to wear masks to enter student health facilities, anyone with respiratory symptoms (e.g., cough, runny nose, and/or sore throat), must still wear a mask when visiting UCSC Student Health. Because masks help protect the mask wearer and others from communicable disease exposure, SHS continues to strongly recommend their use in all healthcare facilities. [California Department of Public Health](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Guidance-on-Isolation-and-Quarantine-for-COVID-19-Contact-Tracing.aspx) and [Cal/OSHA guidelines](https://www.dir.ca.gov/dosh/coronavirus/COVID19FAQs.html) both state that individuals who test positive for COVID-19 must mask for 10 days following a positive test. Depending on community levels, mask requirements may change. Regardless of the COVID-19 community levels, [CDPH recommends](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/guidance-for-face-coverings.aspx): - Wear a mask around others if you have respiratory symptoms - Consider wearing a mask in indoor areas of public transportation - When choosing to wear a mask, ensure your mask provides the best [fit and filtration](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Get-the-Most-out-of-Masking.aspx) - If you've had a significant exposure to someone who has tested positive for COVID-19, wear a mask for 10 days. The university continues to provide free masks to the campus community at the Bay Tree Campus Store, the McHenry, and Science & Engineering Libraries. Employees can [request larger quantities of masks on this form.](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdsPZ2TbFlS-1c-67bYo2Tb-9dv5BzzklNbQXr94sQkXLuTxw/viewform) Isolation Update Most of our campus community is up-to-date on their vaccinations, and there are more therapeutics available now to reduce the severity of COVID-19. Students living in university housing who test positive for COVID-19 will need to self-report and isolate in place and follow the [COVID-19 Positive Test Result instructions.](https://healthcenter.ucsc.edu/services/covid-19/images-pdfs/covid_positive_directions_students.pdf) For any roommates with underlying medical conditions, we may have temporary accommodations available for the period their roommate is in isolation. For any medical related questions or concerns please contact the Student Health Center.
